title: firefox asks for my fingerprint
content: When I log into my financial institution, it asks for my user name and password. This is normal. However, tonight when I tried to log in, a window popped up asking for my fingerprint It identified itself as coming from Firefox. This has not happened before. Is this action true? or a scam? If true, do you know why it has started popping up? (Did I flip a switch in the browser, then forget about it?) I've attached a screen grab of the window. Thanks for your help Tom

title: How to add new dictionary extension to all users in Firefox
content:
Hello, I have Firefox installed in English language and logically has English dictionary. Now, I need that appear also Spanish dictionary. How I could configure it without do it through "Add Dictionaries" button? I followed this thread https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/988617 but unsuccessfully. In summary, I did the following steps: 1. I downloaded Spanish dictionary file (diccionario_de_espanol_espana-3.2.7.xpi) from this web https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/language-tools/ 2. I created the folder "dictionaries" in installation path of Firefox: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\dictionaries 3. In this "dictionaries" folder I put the following files that were inside the dictionary file downloaded in step 1 (diccionario_de_espanol_espana-3.2.7.xpi): es-ES.aff , es-ES.dic and README.txt 4. In the file called firefox.cfg (located in C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox), I added the following line: pref("layout.spellcheckDefault", 2); 5. I restarted Firefox and after that the machine.

After that, don't appear the Spanish dictionary in Firefox. What have I done wrong or what should I do more?

Thanks.
creator: sergio_orishass

title: Tabs close at restart
content:
Hi team,

In the last month I keep having the same issue and I am this close of giving up on Mozilla, although it has been my default browser for years now. After a version update or just closing the entire session, my previous tabs are not being loaded anymore and it suck when I have to re-open 24 tabs, considering that I dont ussualy remember all of them.

Please advise if there is something that I can do to solve this issue! And YES, I do have checked the box with "Open previous windows and tabs" at start-up.

Thank you, Bogdan!

title: My Ubuntu/Firefox displays screen data upside down and backwards - how should this be addressed?
content: Screen data is displayed upside down and backwards - currently booting either Ubuntu or Windows 10 separately - the Windows 10 boot has no problems with either Microsoft Edge or Firefox - the problem occurs when booting Ubuntu with Firefox. I have had this configuration for over seven (7) years with no problems. Any suggestions to correct problem would be appreciated - thanks. Chuck, Simi Valley, California cerco@earthlink.net
creator: cerco

title: Firefox Library Color
content:
After ColorWays was disabled I installed the FireFox Color add-on to recreate the theme I had been using

Everything works fine except when I open the Library window or Add-on windows I get the 'Dark Theme' instead of the 'Light Theme'

After experimenting with different colors I found that the 'Toolbar Color' setting here https://color.firefox.com determines whether the Library is light or dark

It seems only the very lightest colors allow the light theme even though on ColorWays the intermediate themes allowed it and had exactly the same level of brightness as the custom one I created

Is the there any way to independently alter the Library color without having to the change the Toolbar theme I read this https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/manifest.json/theme#colors but it doesn't mention the Library

Thanks
creator: darkwolf573

title: Excessive GPU memory usage when visiting websites (especially watching live streams)
content: Firefox always uses excessive GPU memory when I watch video and livestream. about:memory shows that the explict GPU memory allocation is only about 200 MB but in the task manager the GPU memory usage is 1GB, and the latter doesn't decrease even if I close the tab. I suspect that this is a memory leak. I searched for Bugzilla and found a similar issue that has been existing for years: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1386177
